register.description: SPIO PID Register

bitfield.description: Used to distinguish between old scheme and current. Spare bit to encode future schemes. Fixed to be "01
Function indicates an S/W compatible module family. If there is not level of S/W compatibility, a new Func number (and hence PID) should be assigned
Indicates RTL version

Local revision number which should be owned by module designer. This number should be updated for each major design change (such as bug fix, and memory size change etcÂ…). In present design, fixed to be 0
Indicates a special version for a particular device. Consequence of use may avoid use of standard chip support library (CSL). In this module, fixed to be 0.
Local revision number which should be owned by module designer. This number should be updated for each small design change. In present design, fixed to be 0.

register.description: SPIO Control Register 0

bitfield.description: This bit controls output timing of transmit clock 0 : Data will output at falling edge of transmit clock(default) 1 : Data will output at rising edge of transmit clock Note that this bit should not be changed during transmit function is enabled

bitenum.description: Data will output at falling edge of transmit clock(default)
Data will output at rising edge of transmit clock

bitfield.description: This bit is effective when bit[21] = 0 (non-TS mode), and enables time stamp controls with ATS in non-TS packet 0 : Inactivate 1: Activate

This bit is effective when bit[21] = 0 (non-TS mode), and defines unit data size in non-TS mode. 000 : 200 bytes per packet 001 : 208 bytes per packet 010 : 216 bytes per packet 011 : 224 bytes per packet 100 : 232 bytes per packet 101 : 240 bytes per packet 110 : 248 bytes per packet 111 : 256 bytes per packet
Tx ATS check 00 : outgoing packet has 188 byte 01 : outgoing packet has 192 byte 10 : Reserved 11 : Reserved
TS mode selection 0:Non TS mode 1:TS mode
This bit controls pulse width of Packet start(spio_data_strt_o) in serial mode 0 : 1 cycle width of str_tx_clk_o (default) 1 : 8 cycle width of str_tx_clk_o

TX Interface selection 0: Serial interface with synchronous interface 1: Serial interface with asynchronous interface 2: Parallel interface with synchronous interface 3: Parallel interface with asynchronous interface
Control register for DMA 0:Internal DMA read access disable 1:Internal DMA read access enable
SPIO Transmitter activation 0:SPIO transmitter to be inactivated 1:SPIO transmitter to be activated
This bit is effective when bit[21] = 0 (non-TS mode), and enables time stamp controls with ATS in non-TS packet 0 : Inactivate 1: Activate

This bit is effective when bit[21] = 0 (non-TS mode), and defines unit data size in non-TS mode. 000 : 200 bytes per packet 001 : 208 bytes per packet 010 : 216 bytes per packet 011 : 224 bytes per packet 100 : 232 bytes per packet 101 : 240 bytes per packet 110 : 248 bytes per packet 111 : 256 bytes per packet
Tx ATS check 00 : Nothing to do with incoming data (192 byte) 01 : add res to incoming data (188 byte) 10 : change ATS of Incomming data 11 : Add ATS to incoming data
TS mode selection 0:Non TS mode 1:TS mode
Stream data source 0:Stream source data comes from stream I/F 1:Stream source data comes from DMA I/F

RCV Interface selection 0: Serial interface with synchronous interface 1: Serial interface with asynchronous interface 2: Parallel interface with synchronous interface 3: Parallel interface with asynchronous interface
Control register for DMA 0:Internal DMA read access disable 1:Internal DMA read access enable
SPIO Transmitter activation 0:SPIO transmitter to be inactivated 1:SPIO transmitter to be activated

register.description: SPIO Control Register 1

bitfield.description: Interrupt activation control register 0 : Inactivate 1: Activate
This bit selects storage data format into SDRAM 0 : 32bit Little endian 1: 64 bit width Little endian
This bit enables crc check for PAT/PMT parsing when PID_filter_en is enabled. The error packet will be ignored. 0 : crc flt disable 1 : crc flt enable
This bit enables filtering transport error indicator = 1 in TS header when PID_filter_en is enabled. The error packet will be ignored. 0 : tpei flt disable 1 : tpei flt enable
This bit enables filtering sync byte error in TS header when PID_filter_en is enabled. The error packet will be ignored. 0 : sbyte flt disable 1 : sbyte flt enable
This bit enables detection of GOP start packet with following conditions 0 : Inactivate 1: Activate
Stream Boundary detect 0:use DIT to detect 1: use user specific packet to detect
PID filter selection 0:PID filter inactivated 1: PID filter Activated
PID filter performance mode 000 : Full manual mode 001 : Semi-automatic mode-A 010 : Semi-automatic mode-B 011 : Full-automatic mode 100 - 111 : Reserved

register.description: SPIO Interrupt status Register

bitfield.description: Reflecting interrupt status that STC counter value has reached to configured value of STC interrupt entry counter register on entry number-7 (0x29).
Reflecting interrupt status that STC counter value has reached to configured value of STC interrupt entry counter register on entry number-6 (0x28).
Reflecting interrupt status that STC counter value has reached to configured value of STC interrupt entry counter register on entry number-5 (0x27).
Reflecting interrupt status that STC counter value has reached to configured value of STC interrupt entry counter register on entry number-4 (0x26).
Reflecting interrupt status that STC counter value has reached to configured value of STC interrupt entry counter register on entry number-3 (0x25).
Reflecting interrupt status that STC counter value has reached to configured value of STC interrupt entry counter register on entry number-2 (0x24).
Reflecting interrupt status that STC counter value has reached to configured value of STC interrupt entry counter register on entry number-1 (0x23).
Reflecting interrupt status that STC counter value has reached to configured value of STC interrupt entry counter register on entry number-0 (0x22).
Reflecting interrupt status that SDRAM writing address on ring buffer write channel 7 has reached pointer address configure by ARM via register.
Reflecting interrupt status that SDRAM writing address on ring buffer write channel 6 has reached pointer address configure by ARM via register.
Reflecting interrupt status that SDRAM writing address on ring buffer write channel 5 has reached pointer address configure by ARM via register.
Reflecting interrupt status that SDRAM writing address on ring buffer write channel 4 has reached pointer address configure by ARM via register.
Reflecting interrupt status that SDRAM writing address on ring buffer write channel 3 has reached pointer address configure by ARM via register.
Reflecting interrupt status that SDRAM writing address on ring buffer write channel 2 has reached pointer address configure by ARM via register.
Reflecting interrupt status that SDRAM writing address on ring buffer write channel 1 has reached pointer address configure by ARM via register.
Reflecting interrupt status that SDRAM writing address on ring buffer write channel 0 has reached pointer address configure by ARM via register.
Reflecting interrupt status for receive packet status error. Please refer to RCV_pkt_err register for more details
Reflecting interrupt status for VBUS write status error. Please refer to VBUS_W_STATUS register for more details.
Reflecting interrupt status that SDRAM reading address on ring buffer read channel 0 has reached pointer address configure by ARM via register.
Reflecting interrupt status for detection of new PMT data.
Reflecting interrupt status for detection of new PAT data.
SPIO module detects GOP start packet
Reflecting interrupt status for host due to detection of specific word which is implemented at dividing point (boundary) of program data in transferred TS data

register.description: SPIO Emulation control Register

bitfield.description: This bit defines whether or not a soft or hard stop is initiated whenever the "emususp" is asserted. And this bit is fixed to 1 and read only for SPIO module. SPIO module supports only "soft stop" due to functional restriction related to MPEG-TS (each processing should be executed for each packet as processing unit size).

This bit controls whether or not the peripheral will respond to the emulation suspend signal that it has been programmed to monitor. 0: functions based on configuration of "SPIO_emulsusp_soft". 1: ignores any emulation suspend signal (non-stop).

register.description: Async Tx wait Register

bitfield.description: Wait time between Consecutive packet

register.description: PAT Sense config Register

bitfield.description: Sensing of program association table enable control 0:No PAT filter is active 1: PAT filter is active
Filtered program number of PAT

register.description: PAT store address Register

bitfield.description: Defines the Start address of SDRAM in which Detected PAT is stored.

register.description: PMT Sense config Register

bitfield.description: Sensing of program map table enable control 0: No PMT filter is active 1: PMT filter is active
Filtered PMT_PID

register.description: PMT store address Register

bitfield.description: Defines the Start address of SDRAM in which Detected PMT is stored.

register.description: Boundary sensing packet in Register

bitfield.description: This Value defines PID of specific packet which is inserted at boundary of plural programs inside one TS data.

register.description: Boundary sensing packet in Store address Register

bitfield.description: This register defines start address of SDRAM in which detected boundary sensing packet is stored.

register.description: PCR SENSE config Register

bitfield.description: Sensing of program map table enable control 0:No PCR-PID filter (sensing) is active. 1:PCR-PID filter (sensing) is active
Filtered PCR_PID. This value is defined by PCR-PID value inserted in PMT

register.description: PID0 filter config Register

bitfield.description: Control register of PID filter with configured PID0 0:Filter inactivated 1:Filter activated
Stream type to be filtered and stored into SDRAM with configured PID0
PID0 to be filtered and stored into SDRAM with configured address

register.description: PID1 filter config Register

bitfield.description: Control register of PID filter with configured PID1 0:Filter inactivated 1:Filter activated
Stream type to be filtered and stored into SDRAM with configured PID1
PID1 to be filtered and stored into SDRAM with configured address

register.description: PID2 filter config Register

bitfield.description: Control register of PID filter with configured PID2 0:Filter inactivated 1:Filter activated
Stream type to be filtered and stored into SDRAM with configured PID2
PID2 to be filtered and stored into SDRAM with configured address

register.description: PID3 filter config Register

bitfield.description: Control register of PID filter with configured PID3 0:Filter inactivated 1:Filter activated
Stream type to be filtered and stored into SDRAM with configured PID3
PID3 to be filtered and stored into SDRAM with configured address

register.description: PID4 filter config Register

bitfield.description: Control register of PID filter with configured PID4 0:Filter inactivated 1:Filter activated
Stream type to be filtered and stored into SDRAM with configured PID4
PID4 to be filtered and stored into SDRAM with configured address

register.description: PID5 filter config Register

bitfield.description: Control register of PID filter with configured PID5 0:Filter inactivated 1:Filter activated
Stream type to be filtered and stored into SDRAM with configured PID5
PID5 to be filtered and stored into SDRAM with configured address

register.description: PID6 filter config Register

bitfield.description: Control register of PID filter with configured PID6 0:Filter inactivated 1:Filter activated
Stream type to be filtered and stored into SDRAM with configured PID6
PID6 to be filtered and stored into SDRAM with configured address

register.description: Bypass mode config Register

bitfield.description: This bit controls whether to activate or inactivate SDRAM write access on bypass mode 0:Bypass mode inactivated 1:Bypass mode activated

register.description: TX ATS initial value Register

bitfield.description: ATS Init enabling bit 0:ATS inactivated 1:ATS init activated
Initial value of ATS counter to be loaded with loading pulse generated by configuring above register bit to be 1.

register.description: TX ATS monitor Register

bitfield.description: Monitoring register with which CPU can read present counter value of ATS counter driven in 27[MHz].

register.description: VBUS_Write_Status Register

bitfield.description: Indicates the status for VBUS write status FIFO 0 : Write status FIFO is not occupied 1 : Write status FIFO is full

bitenum.description: Write status FIFO is not occupied

bitfield.description: Indicates the error for VBUS write status 0 : No error 1 : Error
VBUS Write Status 0 : Success 1 : Addressing error 2 : Protection error 3 : Timeout error 4 : RESERVED 5 : Unsupported Addressing Mode error 6 : RESERVED 7 : Exclusive write fail

register.description: RCV_PKT_Status Register

bitfield.description: Indicates pid status of receive error packet. Used for debug purpose.
Ring Buffer Write DMA Error in Sync mode. When this bit is "1", received packet is discarded due to count stall or DMA request has not been finished. This bit is effective in only synchronous mode
This bit indicates when vide packet is ignored until GOP detection.This bit is effective when GOP detection is enabled (SPIO_CTRL1.D5)

This bit indicates when crc error is occurred in PAT/PMT parsing.This bit is effective when pat_sense_cfg/pmt_sense_cfg is enabled and flt_crc bit (SPIO_CTRL1.D12) is activated. The packet will be ignored and any PID are not updated in Semi-B/Full Auto mode
This bit indicates when the packet is ignored with tnasport error Indicator is set 1 in TS header. This bit is effective when PID_filater_en (SPIO_CTRL1.D3) and flt_tpei (SPIO_CTRL1.D9) are enabled
This bit indicates when the packet is ignored when sync byte is not matched 0x47 in TS header. This bit is effective when PID_filater_en (SPIO_CTRL1.D3) and flt_sbyte (SPIO_CTRL1.D8) are enabled

register.description: STC init control Register

bitfield.description: User can load the initialize counter value on 0x21 onto STC counter implemented in counter module on the receiver (figure 1.24). This register is write-only register bit and rising edge of this bit is regarded as loading pulse signal of initialize value for STC counter. The initialize value is written in following address 0x21.

register.description: STC init Value Register

bitfield.description: This register defines STC counter initialize value. The configured value is loaded onto the STC counter with reset pulse which is generated by register "STC_init_ctrl (0x20)".

register.description: STC int entry 00 Register

bitfield.description: This register defines counter value of the STC counter to assert interrupt pulse to CPU. If the STC counter reaches this register value and interrupt condition of this register (please refer to register bit [16] of 0x03~0x07) is activated, the counter asserts an interrupt pulse to CPU.

register.description: STC int entry 01 Register

bitfield.description: This register defines counter value of the STC counter to assert interrupt pulse to CPU. If the STC counter reaches this register value and interrupt condition of this register (please refer to register bit [17] of 0x03~0x07) is activated, the counter asserts an interrupt pulse to CPU.

register.description: STC int entry 02 Register

bitfield.description: This register defines counter value of the STC counter to assert interrupt pulse to CPU. If the STC counter reaches this register value and interrupt condition of this register (please refer to register bit [18] of 0x03~0x07) is activated, the counter asserts an interrupt pulse to CPU.

register.description: STC int entry 03 Register

bitfield.description: This register defines counter value of the STC counter to assert interrupt pulse to CPU. If the STC counter reaches this register value and interrupt condition of this register (please refer to register bit [19] of 0x03~0x07) is activated, the counter asserts an interrupt pulse to CPU.

register.description: STC int entry 04 Register

bitfield.description: This register defines counter value of the STC counter to assert interrupt pulse to CPU. If the STC counter reaches this register value and interrupt condition of this register (please refer to register bit [20] of 0x03~0x07) is activated, the counter asserts an interrupt pulse to CPU.

register.description: STC int entry 05 Register

bitfield.description: This register defines counter value of the STC counter to assert interrupt pulse to CPU. If the STC counter reaches this register value and interrupt condition of this register (please refer to register bit [21] of 0x03~0x07) is activated, the counter asserts an interrupt pulse to CPU.

register.description: STC int entry 06 Register

bitfield.description: This register defines counter value of the STC counter to assert interrupt pulse to CPU. If the STC counter reaches this register value and interrupt condition of this register (please refer to register bit [22] of 0x03~0x07) is activated, the counter asserts an interrupt pulse to CPU.

register.description: STC int entry 07 Register

bitfield.description: This register defines counter value of the STC counter to assert interrupt pulse to CPU. If the STC counter reaches this register value and interrupt condition of this register (please refer to register bit [23] of 0x03~0x07) is activated, the counter asserts an interrupt pulse to CPU.

register.description: TST buf control register

bitfield.description: Tx Buffer Memory Address
